div.p: Greetings. Here I am almost overwhelmed by vile and usurious complaints, nor do those whom you suspect admit any reason. We must await the judgment of the judges.

You rightly guessed about the King of Navarra; for he is at the court in Orléans, but his brother, the Prince of Condé, whom he brought with him, is held captive, and now the Guises triumph. I will remain silent on the rest for now and commend myself to your prayers and those of your friends.
You will inform me about your affairs and diet.
Many from Orléans have been thrown into prison. The inquisition will continue.
The Lord is not idle in the meantime.
To Lord Heinrich Bullinger, the most vigilant pastor of the Church of Zürich. In Zürich.
